reviews.text: We only came to Stuttgart because I wanted to see the Porsche museum/factory tour. In doing my reserach, the Arcotel Camino seemed liked the best option: close to the train station and city center, a brief train ride from Porsche. This was by far the most elegant hotel we stayed in during our two-week trip in Switzerland and Germany, for a reasonable price. We were in room 143 - a triple room, that had a double bed for my parents, and a double couch bed for me. The room was very spacious with high ceilings and a comfortable bathroom. As others noted, it is a brief 5-10 minute walk from the main train station in Stuttgart, but if you are towing a lot of luggage, take a 5 Euro cab ride (we walked with our luggage for our departure, since it was downhill). The local shopping/dining district is also within about a 10-15 minute walk. Since I was just off from a business trip and was keeping in touch with my husband at home, I was using the wired internet access they offered for free, which was spotty at best. You can pay to upgrade, but I tried to do that on my last morning there and it didn't work so well. Also, we checked out before leaving for our Porsche tour (which is an easy train ride from the main train station) and asked to leave our luggage in their "secure luggage room" - when we returned 5-6 hours later, it was still sitting on a cart in the lobby. We ate in their bar restaurant when we arrived - their main restaurant looks very nice, but you can only order their more expensive meals to eat there; if you want a sandwich or other casual dining, you need to eat in the bar. Overall, a very nice, comfortable hotel, and a quiet stay.
reviews.title: Great stop for experiencing the Porsche museum

reviews.text: We stayed at the Arcotel Camino October 2009. Having just come from Amsterdam, we found the Amsterdam hotel staff to be more friendly, but the Arcotel staff was definitely helpful. The hotel was very, very clean, in a great location in terms of hopping on the city trains, and offered a great breakfast in the morning. The only complaint we really had was my husband felt the carpet made him dizzy and that perhaps the hotel had bit of sterile feel. I'd rather have a hotel too tidy than be on the dirty side, however.

reviews.title: Decent hotel
reviews.text: I chose the Arcotel Camino because I wanted a place near the train station and near the downtown where I could stay with my wife and daughter and not pay too much money. I booked a suite, with my daughter sleeping in the adjoining room.

reviews.title: Very impressed by this hotel
reviews.text: The suite was fine. The Internet connection was good. The front desk staff went out of its way to help me when I was trying to find a candle for a small birthday cake for my daughter.

reviews.title: Very friendly staff, lovely hotel
reviews.text: One warning: the hotel is up a slight incline, about 300 meters from the train station, in case you are planning to walk. I did it, but I huffed and puffed a bit.

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: The hotel faces a busy thoroughfare with nothing charming around it. It's about a five-block walk to a pedestrian area with shops and restaurants.

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
reviews.text: The room was big and very nicely decorated. We really liked the contemporary look which was a big contrast with the other Europeans hotel we saw during the length of our stay. The bathroom was big as well. Everything seemed new and very clean. They had free "56kb wired" internet, which was great!

reviews.title: Comfotable hotel with a very good breakfast

reviews.title: New hotel, Good service, Trendy room
reviews.text: One of the best things was the buffet breakfast which was very extensive and I thought quite good value at 17 Euros. The weekend rate was a bargain at 80 Euros per room and with an adjoining room for our children worked out very well.
